name: Fair Scones
author: Drew Britten
summary: A hallmark of the Puyallup and Evergreen State Fairs in Washington State. Now you can make them at home any time of year. Just like at the fair, they are best served hot, with butter and raspberry jam.
directions: Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl
Cut shortening into flour mixture with a fork or pastry knife until crumbly texture
Add milk; mix until just combined
Turn dough onto a floured surface; knead until completely mixed, about 1 minute
Roll or pat each piece into a 3/4-inch round
Arrange pieces on a baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 15 minutes
